xml.bio: I am a Ph.D. student in Computer Science advised by Dr. Kristy Elizabeth Boyer. My interests are in user-adaptive dialogue systems, machine learning, and computational linguistics.
xml.research:
My current project considers how an adaptive, dialogue-based car navigation system can help a driver learn to navigate in a new city and provide summarized route instructions using a model of driver road knowledge.


The interface for a study of how humans teach a route.


Logging driving history to use as evidence of road knowledge.
